newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX ACCESS energy prices rise, APIs delayed.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX ACCESS energy prices rise, APIs delayed.

text.p: NYMEX ACCESS energy prices rose overnight, brokers said, trimming daytime losses amid technical buying.
April NYMEX rose 14 cents a barrel from the settle to $20.25, amid 1,690 lots traded overall, 485 traded in April and 862 traded in May.
The American Petroleum Institute (API) postponed its Tuesday U.S. crude and products inventory report. The trade group was unable to confirm when the data would be released.
NYMEX heating oil traded at 53.10 cents a gallon, up 0.27 cents from the settle amid volume of 28 lots in April and 37 in all months. Gasoline was bought at 64.25 cents, up 0.39 cents, traders said.
